availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Clerk of the old Bank of the United States Branch at Lexington and U.S. Pension Agent for Kentucky during the early 1830s. Cashier of the Northern Bank of Kentucky, when it succeeded the Bank of the United States at Lexington. Became Cashioer of the Agricultural Deposit Bank of Lexington in the late 1840s. Unanimously re-elected cashier of the Agricultural Deposit Bank, Lexington, Kentucky, November 1856. Owned a thoroughbred farm, Walnut Hill Stud, four miles from Lexington, on the Richmond Road. His thoroughbreds included some of the most noted race horses of the period. Grinstead became a director of the Kentucky Association and as Steward of the Saratoga Association, Saratoga, New York. Also served as Fayette County Clerk during the late 1840s. Entered partnership with Thomas Bradley in 1863, to operate a private bank.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, Entry for James Grinstead (died 1886), Find A Grave Memorial # 99343724, Lexington Cemetery, Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=grinstead&GSfn=james&GSbyrel=all&GSdy=1886&GSdyrel=in&GSob=n&GRid=99343724&df=all& (accessed 8 Aug 2017).
"Grinstead, James A.," WixiLex, Lexington History Museum, http://lexhistory.org/wikilex/grinstead-james.
